title: 2 bedroom end of terrace house for rent
description: Parkers proudly offer to market this two double bedroom end of terrace home, situated within the highly sought-after 'Old Kiln Lakes' development on the outskirts of Chinnor, Oxfordshire. In brief, the property consists of: entrance hall, downstairs cloakroom, large utility/ storage cupboard, modern open-plan kitchen/living room with patio doors leading out onto the private rear garden. Upstairs the property boasts two double bedrooms, with en-suite shower room to the master, as well as a spacious family bathroom. Outside the property has a private rear garden, which provides a large decking area, as well as an artificial lawn, garden shed and rear access to the two private tandem-style parking spaces. <PARA> Ground Floor: <PARA> Upon entering the property you are welcomed into an entrance hall, which provides access into a well-presented downstairs cloakroom and a handy utility cupboard with plumbing for a washing machine/ tumble drier. The entrance hallway then opens out into the fantastic open plan living area. The kitchen provides ample storage at both eye and waist level, as well as a stylish breakfast bar, and the living area is well-proportioned and boasts double doors leading out onto the rear garden. <PARA> First Floor: <PARA> Upstairs there are two double bedrooms and a family bathroom. Both bedrooms are light and spacious, with the master bedroom benefitting from an immaculate en-suite shower room and bedroom two from fitted wardrobes. The family bathroom consists of a bath, wash basin, W/C and heated towel rail. <PARA> Outside: <PARA> To the rear of the property there is off-road parking for two vehicles, as well as gated access into the rear garden. The rear garden is served by both areas of decking and artificial lawn. <PARA> The Location: <PARA> 'Old Kiln Lakes' is a sought after development on the edge of the village of Chinnor, offering beautiful walks around the lakes and up into the Chiltern Hills. This particular property is within a short walk of the historical Grade II listed Beehive Kiln, a fantastic landmark and part of Chinnor's history to have on your doorstep. <PARA> Chinnor itself and the surrounding hamlets are part of the ancient chain of villages following the spring line at the foot of the Chiltern escarpment. <PARA> With a population of around 7000, the village offers good local shopping facilities, including a supermarket, village store, Post Office, bakery, butchers and a pharmacy. There are also doctors & dentists, hairdressers, sports fields, play areas for children and a selection of public houses, as well as two Indian restaurants, a Chinese takeaway and Fish & Chip shop. <PARA> A superb village centre has been created providing a coffee shop, day care for the elderly, a youth centre and a wide range of services and activities. <PARA> The M40 motorway (Junction 6) is only three miles from Chinnor and provides excellent road links to both Oxford (15 miles) and London (30 miles). The Oxford Tube stop is extremely popular with commuters. <PARA> Princes Risborough station is only four miles away which operates on the Chiltern Line, providing services to both Birmingham Moor Street and London Marylebone. There is also a regular bus service to Thame, High Wycombe and Oxford. <PARA> Chinnor is also served by two primary schools, Mill Lane Community Primary School and St Andrews Church of England Primary School. Local secondary schools are Lord Williams in Thame (five miles) and Icknield High School in Watlington (six miles). <PARA>

Higher rates apply for high-season summer months <PARA> Location <PARA> This elegant and character-filled home in Maida Vale, close to the waterways of Little Venice, offers a warm and stylish London base for families or groups seeking space, comfort and a truly distinctive setting. Set across two levels, the property combines period charm with thoughtfully curated interiors, creating a welcoming retreat in one of west London’s most picturesque areas. <PARA> Property Description <PARA> The home accommodates up to six guests and features four bedrooms arranged over two floors, connected by internal stairs. There are two double bedrooms and two single bedrooms, with the two upstairs bedrooms including mezzanine levels that add a unique and playful architectural touch. The property has two bathrooms, one fitted with a bath and the other with a walk-in shower. Located on the lower ground floor, the layout benefits from generous proportions and a sense of privacy, while still enjoying excellent natural light. <PARA> The living room is a beautifully styled space that blends character, warmth and sophistication, making it a true highlight of the home. Period features such as high ceilings, decorative cornicing and a classic fireplace create a sense of heritage, while rich textures and bold colour choices add depth and refinement. Please note that the fireplace is decorative and not in use. Deep blue velvet seating is complemented by patterned accent chairs, antique-style furniture and carefully selected artwork, giving the room a timeless and elegant feel. Statement lighting and playful ceiling details add personality, while large windows and glazed doors allow daylight to flow through, enhancing the airy and welcoming ambience. <PARA> Flowing naturally from the living area, the kitchen and dining space is equally impressive. The kitchen combines traditional style with modern practicality, featuring dark-toned cabinetry, open shelving and brass fittings that give it a bespoke, country-inspired character. A tiled splashback and classic range-style cooker add further charm, while the solid wooden dining table forms a warm and sociable centrepiece, ideal for shared meals, relaxed breakfasts or long evenings together. Guests also have access to a communal garden, providing a peaceful outdoor space to enjoy during warmer months. <PARA> Neighbourhood <PARA> Maida Vale is known for its elegant streets, grand mansion blocks and relaxed village feel. The area is perfect for leisurely walks, with leafy avenues and easy access to the canals and waterside paths of Little Venice. A scenic walk along the canal brings you towards Paddington Basin, passing cafés, houseboats and charming local spots along the way, making this one of the most picturesque walking routes in west London. <PARA> Food and drink options in Maida Vale and Little Venice are varied and well regarded, ranging from relaxed cafés to classic pubs and refined restaurants. The neighbourhood is home to welcoming local pubs, cosy eateries and waterside dining spots serving everything from traditional British fare to modern European cuisine, all contributing to the area’s calm yet vibrant atmosphere. <PARA> Transport connections are excellent, making it easy to explore London. Warwick Avenue station is approximately a four-minute walk away, offering access to the Bakerloo line, with a direct journey of around fifteen minutes to Oxford Circus. Maida Vale station is also nearby. Paddington station can be reached via a pleasant fifteen-minute walk along the canal or a short five-minute tube journey, providing National Rail services, Underground connections and the Elizabeth line for fast access across London and beyond. <PARA> Please note: a security camera is in place monitoring the external access to the flat door for safety and security purposes only. There are no cameras inside the property. <PARA> Starting rates from £ 7,800PCM. <PARA> Mid Let Security Deposit (stays of 3 to under 6 months): £500 <PARA> Minimum length of stay (for this mid let price): 3 months to under 6 months <PARA> Council tax band: G
